net.objectof.model

Interface Resource<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Named
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Category, Category, Geo, JsStep, Location, Member, Other, Person, Property, Schema, Step
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ICategory, ICategoryBean, ICategoryBean, IComposite, IGeoBean, IIndexed, IJsStepBean, ILocationBean, IMapped, IMember, IMemberBean, IOtherBean, IPersonBean, IProperty, IPropertyBean, IResource, ISchema, ISchemaBean, IStepBean

    public interface Resource<T>
extends Named
    A Resource is a Named reference to an object. The resource can be a reference to an object (value() returns a different object) or the object itself by returning "this" for value(). Resource that return "this" for value() are termed Components.

    (TENTATIVE) The equality of Resource is determined by: this.id().equals(a.id()) && this.version().equals(a.version())

    Author:
    jdh

        Parameters:
        aMediaType - The format of the data stream

      • value

        T value()
 throws ResourceException
        Obtain the resource value. Implementors are free to implement a lazy pattern to return the resource, i.e. a Resource can defer accessing the associated resource manager until this method is called. Whether the resource obtained is current or aged (e.g. through being cached) is not defined by this interface however sub-interfaces or concrete implementations may refine the contract.
        Returns:
        The resource itself.
        Throws:
        ResourceException

      • version

        java.lang.Object version()
                  throws ResourceException
        Returns:
        The version of the resource or null when the resource is not (yet) persistent. Sub-interfaces may define a more specific return type to provide additional status on the resource or this reference to it.
        Throws:
        ResourceException

      • tx

        Transaction tx()
        Returns:
        the Transaction which loaded this object
